algorithm_technique: Iterate through columns, then rows, checking for lexicographical order.
Transpose strings and check each new row for lexicographical order.
problem_summary_simple: Delete columns from a grid of strings if they are not sorted lexicographically.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through columns of a string grid, counting columns where characters are not in non-decreasing order.
key_insights: The core idea is to check each column independently for sorted order.
A nested loop structure is natural for column-wise traversal.
Breaking early within a column check optimizes performance.
Transposing the grid simplifies column-wise checks into row-wise checks.
Checking for any unsorted pair within a transposed row is concise.
